items.description: Gets an existing document from the database.
items.example:
# Loads the 'TASK-00001' document into memory
doc = frappe.get_doc('Task', 'TASK-00001')

items.description: Creates a new document in memory (not saved).
items.example:
doc = frappe.new_doc('Task')
doc.subject = 'My new task'
doc.status = 'Open'

items.description: Saves a new document to the database for the first time.
items.example:
doc = frappe.new_doc('Task')
doc.subject = 'Task to be inserted'
doc.insert()

items.description: Saves the changes of an existing document to the database.
Deletes a document from the database.
Gets the last saved document of a DocType.
Adds a new row to a child table.
Reloads the document from the database, discarding local changes.
items.example:
doc = frappe.get_doc('User', 'test@example.com')
# ...someone else changes the doc...
doc.reload()
# 'doc' now has the latest data
